item.title: [HIVE-8915] Log file explosion due to non-existence of COMPACTION_QUEUE table
item.description:
I hit an issue with a fresh set up of hive in a vm, where I did not have db tables as specified by hive-txn-schema-0.14.0.mysql.sql created.

On metastore startup, I got an endless loop of errors being populated to the log file, which caused the log file to grow to 1.7GB in 5 minutes, with 950k copies of the same error stack trace in it before I realized what was happening and killed it. We should either have a delay of sorts to make sure we don't endlessly respin on that error so quickly, or we should error out and fail if we're not able to start.

comments.comment: gates, you might be interested in this issue.
Yeah, I hit this too. What is the fix, gates?

I was facing the same issue. If you do not want this error then create an empty database in mysql for hive and set up following property in hive-site.xml:
<property>
<name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL</name>
<value>jdbc:mysql://192.168.1.15:3306/hive_metastore</value>
</property>

Do not add "?createDatabaseIfNotExist=true"

Run following command from hive bin to create hive schema in "hive_metastore" db :
bin/schematool -dbType mysql -initSchema -verbose

then start metastore and hiveserver2 services

This patch makes it so that the worker and cleaner don't go into a tight loop throwing errors. With this patch, if the transaction tables aren't in the database the logs are around 200K.

owen.omalley suggested that we should make it so that the metastore died if the proper tables weren't in place. We could still do that, but I felt that was separate from this patch because what this patch really fixed was making sure any error that occurred inside the compactor threads didn't result in a tight loop.
